events.title: Battle of Cajamarca
events.description: Spanish conquistador Francisco Pizarro captures the Inca emperor Atahualpa during a surprise attack, marking the beginning of Spanish conquest in Peru.
events.significance: This event led to the collapse of the Inca Empire and significant Spanish colonization in South America.

events.title: Indianapolis 500 Inaugural Race
events.description: The first Indianapolis 500 automobile race is held in Indiana, USA.
events.significance: The race became one of the most prestigious motorsport events in the world, influencing automobile engineering and racing culture.

events.title: Nuremberg Trials Begin
events.description: The International Military Tribunal commences trials of prominent leaders of Nazi Germany for war crimes.
events.significance: These trials set precedents for international law and accountability in cases of war crimes and crimes against humanity.

events.title: UN Framework Convention on Climate Change Adopted
events.description: The United Nations General Assembly adopts the UNFCCC treaty addressing global warming and greenhouse gas emissions.
events.significance: The convention laid the groundwork for later international climate agreements, including the Kyoto Protocol and Paris Agreement.
